definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: You can see me in this old photo, standing in the back row.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在这张老照片中找到我，我当时站在后排。

sentences.english: Although the back row space comes to valuable be bigger than, but is also far from spaciously .
sentences.chinese: 后排空间虽比宝来要大，但也谈不上宽敞。

sentences.english: With a sigh she walked back to her other students who were clustered at the back table patiently waiting her return.
sentences.chinese: 她叹了口气，回到后排那一群正耐心等著她的学生。

sentences.english: Those sitting in the back began rushing to the front of the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 坐在后排的乘客开始往客舱的前面冲。

sentences.english: He looked through the screen and saw that Bill and Ted were in the back seat.
sentences.chinese: 透过纱窗，他看到比尔和特德坐在后排。

sentences.english: Backline firm with a slight rise over a short and well muscled loin.
sentences.chinese: 公司与后排在短期轻微上升，肌肉发达的腰部。

sentences.english: Ugh!” The woman goes to the rear of the bus and sits down, fuming.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人生气的走到巴士后排坐下。

sentences.english: These divisions are further enhanced by the colour and trim selection.
sentences.chinese: 色料选择也是区分前后排乘坐空间的要素。

sentences.english: I get carsick in the back seat so I call dibs on the front seat.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在后排晕车，我有权要求坐在前面。

sentences.english: Grooves extend to the finished edge, but rear perforations are not visible.
sentences.chinese: 凹槽延伸到成品的优势，但后排齿孔中不可见。

sentences.english: So, what are your questions? Yes, in back.
sentences.chinese: 你们的问题是什么，你来，后排那位。

sentences.english: For added passenger comfort, rear seats recline 12 degrees.
sentences.chinese: 为增加乘客的舒适，后排座椅放倒12度。

sentences.english: I was sitting in the back row.
I'd like two seats in the rear stalls.
sentences.chinese: 我想要两张正厅后排的票子。

sentences.english: First, the two back seats are designed according to the business cabin on plane.
sentences.chinese: 首先是两个完全按飞机公务舱设计的后排座椅。

definition: empress's throne/(fig.) first place in a feminine competition
glove compartment (of a car)/glovebox (sealed compartment with attached gloves for handling hazardous materials etc)
car door/door of bus, railway carriage etc
